{{Infobox Broadcast | call_letters = DXEC-TV | station_logo = [[Image:Abs cbn.png|150px]] | station_slogan = ''In the Service of the Filipino Worldwide'' | station_branding = ABS-CBN 2 Cagayan de Oro | analog = 2 ([[VHF]]) | digital = | other_channel = 23 ([[UHF]]) | affiliations = [[ABS-CBN]] | founded = February 1986 | location = [[Cagayan de Oro City]] | sister_stations = [[DXCE-TV]] ([[Studio 23]])| | owner = [[ABS-CBN Broadcasting Corporation]] | former_affiliations = | former_callsigns = | effective_radiated_power = ERP 1,500 watts | website = [http://www.abs-cbn.com/ '''www.abs-cbn.com'''] }}
'''DXEC-TV''' (ABS-CBN Cagayan de Oro) Channel 2 and Channel 23, are the sister stations of the Philippine television network [[ABS-CBN Broadcasting Corporation]]. Its studios and transmitter are located at the ABS-CBN Broadcasting Complex in Macapagal Drive (formerly Greenhills Road) Bulua, [[Cagayan de Oro City]], [[Misamis Oriental]]. with a transmitting power of 1.5 kilowatts (1,500 watts), with an ERP of 5 kilowatt. It is the second largest [[ABS-CBN]] station in the [[Mindanao]] island.
ABS-CBN Cagayan de Oro is making a live coverage and updates during the Kagay-an Festival every August.
Recently, Boto Mo, Ipatrol Mo and Bilib sa Kagay-anon had their grand launching in [[Cagayan de Oro City]].
